editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Scholars of Merton College.

msItem.note: Fols. 1, 3v, 5v-6 blank; on 4-5, 6v are faint pencil notes. On fols. 2-3 are medical notes in small anglicana hands. On f. 6v is an early table of contents.

msItem.author: IOHANNITIUS
msItem.title: Isagoge ad Galeni Artem Paruam
msItem.incipit: Medicina diuiditur in duas partes scil. theoricam et practicam
msItem.note: Ed. D. Garcia and J. L. Vidal, Asclepio 26-7 (1974-5), 267-382; TKI 856, 1352.

msItem.author: THEOPHILUS
msItem.title: De Vrinis
msItem.incipit: De urinarum differencia negotium multi ueterum medicorum agressi sunt scribere

msItem.author: PHILARETUS
msItem.title: De Pulsibus
msItem.incipit: Intencionem habemus hac presenti conscripcione de pulsuum negocio compendiosam exponere tradicionem
msItem.explicit: in mortem fignans. Et hec nobis sufficiant ad presencia.

msItem.note: HIPPOCRATES, Aphorismi, with the commentary of GALEN, transl. CONSTANTINE THE AFRICAN

msItem.author: GALEN
msItem.title: Commentary on Hippocrates' Aphorismata (tr. Constantinus Africanus)

msItem.rubric: Incipit liber Afforismorum Ypocratis cum commento Galieni.
msItem.incipit: Prefacio domini Constantini Affricani Montis Cassianensis monachi ad Hattonem discipulum suum. Licet peticionibus tuis continue
Vita breuis ars uero longa
Plurimi interpretes huius libri in hoc maxime sunt concordati
msItem.explicit: et non esse ypocratica consummare poterit.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit commentum G. super librum Afforismorum Ypocratis.
msItem.note: Text and comm. pr. as part of the Articella, Padua 1476 &c.; text TKI 1704, 828, this copy HL 56; comm. TKI 1055; HL 39-40.
HIPPOCRATES, Prognostica, with the commentary of GALEN, transl. CONSTANTINE THE AFRICAN or GERARD OF CREMONA

msItem.author: GALEN
msItem.title: Commentary on Hippocrates' Prognostica (tr. Constantinus Africanus or Gerard of Cremona)

msItem.rubric: Incipit liber pronosticorum cum duplici translatione.
msItem.incipit: Omnis qui medicine artis studio seu gloriam seu dilectabilem amicorum consequi desiderat
Videtur mihi quod de melioribus rebus est ut utatur
Manifestum est quod Ypocrates non utitur hoc nomine
msItem.explicit: et in quibusdam earum in die lxo. Explicit.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit commentum pronosticorum cum duplici translacione.
msItem.note: Pr. as part of the Articella, Padua 1476 &c.; text TKI 1002, 847; this copy HL 210.
De Regimine Acutorum Morborum, with the commentary of GALEN, transl. CONSTANTINUS AFRICANUS or GERARD OF CREMONA

msItem.author: GALEN
msItem.title: Commentary on Hippocrates' Regimen acutorum (tr. Gerard of Cremona)

msItem.rubric: Incipit liber Ypocratis de regimine acutorum cum duplici translatione
msItem.incipit: Qui de egrotancium accidentibus
msItem.finalRubric: Finit liber de dieta acutarum egritudinum
msItem.incipit: Qui sentencias illorum de assibus relatas scripserunt
Non solum scripserunt rememoracionem sentenciarum relatarum si hora talia fiat
msItem.note: Text and commentary pr. Articella, Padua 1476, &c.; TKI 1205, 660, 922; HL 9.

Bk. III ends on f. 144 with ‘... preterque infinitis ipsas ei dicat. Explicit liber acutarum regiminum et commentum cum duplici translatione’; f. 144v blank. Bk. IV beg. impf. on f. 145: ‘Cassus autem fit cum de siccitate uernule in estiua hora (text); multi tales in ultimis partibus (glo.). The marginal glosses beg. ‘Iste liber diuiditur in prohemium et tractatum’ (as TKI 794, but this is a commentary on the Aphorismi).
GALEN, Tegni, with the commentary of ALI IBN RODHAN (HALY ABBAS), transl. GERARD OF CREMONA

msItem.author: ʻAlī ibn Riḍwān, -approximately 1068
msItem.title: Commentary on Galen's Tegni (tr. Gerard of Cremona)

msItem.rubric: Incipit commentum super librum Tegni Galeni ab Haly.
msItem.incipit: Intendimus edere sermonem exponentem illud quod clausum est de sermone. Ga. in hoc libro suo qui notatur ars parua. Dico ergo quod Ga. nominat hunc librum artem paruam
Tres sunt omnes doctrine
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit commentum Haly super Tegni cum duplici translacione. Deo gratias
msItem.incipit: In omnibus doctrinis que secundum ordinem currunt
Doctrina est actio doctoris in discipulum
msItem.explicit: quod magis completum est. Sicut lucerna relucens in abscondito ... In anno Domini nostri Iesu Christi M. C. 87.
msItem.note: Text pr. Articella, Venice 1487; TKI 757, 1585; comm. pr. Articella, Venice 1483; TKI 700. The last paragraph of the commentary is the ‘nominacio librorum’ or account of Gerard of Cremona’s translations, ed. K. Sudhoff, 'Die kurze "Vita" und das Verzeichnis der Arbeiten Gerhards von Cremona', Archiv für Geschichte der Medizin 8 (1914), 73-82, at pp. 75-80.
GILES OF CORBEIL, De Pulsibus, with the commentary of GENTILE DA FOLIGNO

msItem.author: GENTILE DA FOLIGNO
msItem.title: Commentary on Giles of Corbeil's De Pulsibus

msItem.incipit: Ingenii uires modicis conatibus impar
msItem.explicit: Iam sterilem cultum Philareti uomitis horret.
msItem.incipit: Quatuor sunt membra principalia
Auctor iste more recte scribentium operi suo prescribit proemium
msItem.note: Text ed. L. Choulant (Leipzig, 1826), pp. 28-43; TKI 744; commentary pr. Padua 1484 &c.; TKI 161, 1181.
GILES OF CORBEIL, De Vrinis, glossed by GILBERTUS ANGLICUS

msItem.author: GILBERTUS ANGLICUS
msItem.title: Commentary on Giles of Corbeil's De urinis

msItem.incipit: Sicut dicit Constantinus in Pantengni et hoc idem testatur Iohannicius
Dicitur urina quoniam fit renibus una
msItem.explicit: (line 338) Aggrauat et cumulat mala circumstantia culpam
msItem.incipit: Tribus modis notificat urinam
msItem.finalRubric: Expliciunt glosule magistri Gilberti super uersus Egidii.
msItem.note: Text ed. Choulant, pp. 4-18; WIC 4432; TKI 422; Wickersheimer 196-7; comm. unpr.; TKI(1483), 1588.
Throughout, but especially to arts 1-4, is extensive glossing in early anglicana hands, mostly in the margins but occasionally between the lines.

supportDesc.extent:
268 leaves (ii + 266) 290 200
200 140
The edges savagely retrimmed with loss of marginalia and spattered with red. The last six leaves have been affected by ?heat, causing shrinkage and warping.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with pencil in 2 cols of 50 lines of gloss; the text, in larger script, on every second line. Blocks of text and gloss alternate.

handDesc.handNote: Neat English gothic rotunda bookhands, slightly less formal in the gloss.

decoDesc.decoNote: Red and blue initials flourished in the colours and violet, with partial borders; blue initials flourished in red, red initials flourished in violet; red paraphs, highlighting and underlining; running heads in red and blue capitals.

binding.p: Standard Merton s. xvii, repaired, rebacked and resewn on six bands; formerly chained from the usual position. Fols. i-ii, 265-6 are modern paper blanks. fol. 1, a pastedown in an earlier binding, has marks of two foredge straps and of straps at head and tail.

history.provenance: On f. 1v ‘Liber magistri Willelmi Duffeld ex empcione’. Below, in a very formal hand, is ‘Liber domus scolarium de Merton Hall Oxonie ex dono Magistri Willelmi Duffeld archidiaconi Clyuelandie ad inchatenandum infra librariam ibidem.’ At the foot of f. 264v ‘Magister Willelmus Duffeld dedit librum istum magistro Ioh’ Somerseth ad terminum uite sue ita quod post uitam eius remaneat in collegio de Merton’ Oxon’ in eternum.’ For Duffield, fellow in 1398, no longer in 1422, see MS 91. Somerset (BRUO 1727-8) studied at Oxford then migrated to Cambridge because of the plague, MD by 1428, physician to Henry VI from that year, still in 1447, d. by 1455.

Inside the front board is a sheet of paper with table of contents, s. xvii, and ‘P. 2. 4. Art:’, canc. and replaced with ‘No. CCXXI’ and ‘N. 3. 4’ in red. The College bookplate. ‘4’ is inked on the foredge.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.
